intro: Lissanthe depressa, commonly known as the dwarf lissanthe, is a small, herbaceous plant native to southern Africa. It typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is often found in coastal or semi-arid regions. The plant features tiny, clustered flowers that are usually yellow or pale green, and its leaves are narrow and fleshy. It is a member of the Acanthaceae family and is known for its compact growth habit. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and specialized species.
